title: Understanding Instructional Design Theory Through Collaborative Inquiry

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of curriculum design, foundational language acquisition skills
context.additional_context: A peer feedback-centered collaborative learning environment utilizing smartphone-based VR simulations.

learning_goals: Learners explain fundamental concepts of instructional design theories using linguistic similarities and differences.
Learners document the process of applying theories to real educational cases through collaboration with peers in VR simulation environments.
Learners describe the progression of their theoretical understanding in three+ stages via reflective journaling.

resources: LMS Platform with Voice Recording Feedback
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
